website_summaries.verdict: This is a quiet, yet powerful little vacuum that's perfect for multi-level homes with hard floors and low-pile carpet.
pros: Quickly switch between carpeted and hard floors
Integrated carrying handle for easy maneuverability
Crevice tool and dusting brush included
cons: It can be difficult to keep the hoses and attachments together

website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight canister vacuum from a trusted brand that has excellent suction power for a vacuum costing under $100.
pros: It has an easy-to-clean dust canister, works fine on thicker carpeting, and can be easily pulled along when vacuuming without coming apart
Holds up to 2 liters of dust and dirt
Can clean and reuse filters, saving on ongoing maintenance costs
cons: Hose extenders could be designed better
clicking them into place can be slightly tricky

customer_reviews.title: Best Vacuum Evar.
customer_reviews.text: I have a bad back and have been using a heavy, pushy vacuum for years. When I saw this I thought my prayers were answered- and they were! It's light weight, versatile, and SUCKS. Oh boy, does it have a good sucker. I have hardwood floors and bought an extra brushy floor attachment, the best part is the heads can flex around corners so I can easily pick up the hose and put it anywhere! The old vacuum I'd have to switch between floor & hose mode constantly, this way I can just get everything at once! The best part? It's small, easy to clean, and it has a retractable cord. THE CORD RETRACTS <3
customer_reviews.author: toffeeCoo

customer_reviews.title: My  daughter's toy vacuum is better quality
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something lightweight and inexpensive to use on my carpeted stairwell. This vacuum is a disappointment in virtually every way. The suction quality is mediocre at best. The hose attachment falls off. It is not meant for carpet; nor is it meant for area rugs. It doesn't work on those either. This should clearly be advertised as a vacuum for bare floors. It is too much of a hassle to ship it back at this point. So, I'm setting it out by the dumpster for someone to take...if they wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: small but packs a punch
customer_reviews.text: I love the color, I love how small it is, I love the suction power, I love how easy it is to use, how well it fits in corners and under furniture. The only tiny downside is the cord, I have had a cordless vacuum for years so it takes some getting used to. But overall a 5 star rating so far. We have a bunch of other Bissell green line items such as the carpet cleaner and the upholstery cleaner and we're super happy with all of their stuff so far.
customer_reviews.author: Winsett family

customer_reviews.title: Its plastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum itself seems durable but the pipe and the attachments are made up of cheap flimsy plastic that are used for toy cars bought from a $1 store. The floor attachment and the wheels..omg it reminded me of the plastic toy race cars and those wheels that would break after the a couple of uses. I get it, you get what you pay for but honestly Ive bought bissell canister vacuums for less and they where built much better. So disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THIS VACUUM WOULD SUCK THE CHROME OFF A BUMPER
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING THE STRENGTH - HOWEVER IT IS TRUE - BECAUSE OF NO LOCKING HANDLES TO THE POLE - WHEN VACUUMING, THE POLE DOES PULL APART - AND IT ANNOYING. I HAD READ THE REVIEWS - THAT SAID IT DID THAT - BUT THE OTHER OPTION IS LOCKING POLE WITH VACUUM BAGS, OR THIS ONE - NON-LOCKING POLES, BAGLESS. I CHOSE BAGLESS - WHICH I LIKE - I HOLD THE HANDLE AT THE SEAM AND GO SLOW, BUT I DONT HAVE TO DEAL WITH ORDERING BAGS AND CHANGING BAGS - SO ITS YOUR CHOICE. IF THEY MADE LOCKING POLE HANDLE AND BAGLESS - WOULD BE PERFECT.
customer_reviews.author: david kaminski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lightweight Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum. I bought it because I was tired of lugging around a huge heavy one. This not only is super light, I love the retracting cord and it has amazing suction. It did a great job with only one time over the area. My only thing is; I wish I had known that the floor nossle isn’t very wide, so it does smaller sections at a time. I really don’t mind that though. Overall, wonderful product! It’s also quiet enough that it didn’t wake up my sleeping 3 month old in the room down the hall!
customer_reviews.author: Kpossa DroneMale

customer_reviews.title: Hubby called it a game changer
customer_reviews.text: I love my primary vacuum but wanted to get this as a quick and easy vacuum for the smaller areas and stairs. I was so happy to see this had a retractable cold. It can be a bit finicky towards the end of rewinding it but I’m still happy with it. The set up of it is nice. Everything has a place. The suction power is great. I ordered a horse hair attachment and they work great together for smaller areas like heating vents, patios sliding doors, etc. My husband rarely vacuums but called this a game changer. Maybe it’ll inspire him to vacuum more?
customer_reviews.author: Sprior

customer_reviews.title: Great suction but not good with logistics
customer_reviews.text: My young children love to use this vacuum under supervision with only one attached tube. I'm astounded at the suction power. The tubes should click in place because they will come undone if you don’t. The quality of the extenders is very poor. However this vacuum DOES work on carpet quite well. But it would be less frustrating if it didn’t fall apart while in use. While this is annoying to me, I am outraged that there’s no place to store the attachments on the vacuum!!! Thus, we lost them within 30 minutes of unpacking the vacuum. I’m sure they’ll turn up?
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: Good machine for floors or low pile rugs, great suction.
customer_reviews.text: First vacuuming appears to have better suction than my 2-ton Shark Navigator that can't get under the bed, can't reach into a corner or edge of rug by the stove where crumbs collect...arrrgh. My only issue is the kind of short hose/stick attachment so I vacuumed bent over. If you prefer vacuuming standing straight up and can spend more, consider another vacuum, but for the price this little machine gets the job done. I should qualify my comments with a caveat that my rugs are very low pile, do not even consider this machine for anything with higher pile, not built for it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.58

customer_reviews.title: Not worth compared to other machines, same price
customer_reviews.text: Great suction. BUT the hose constantly pulls off, it doesn't push forward on carpet (a combination of the wheels being too small and the scraper on the front being poorly designed.) This is perfect if you want to use it for hardwood or tile floors. It was perfect for those sections of my house, but not my carpets. Since my only tiles are bathrooms/kitchen its not worth me keeping and then having to have two machines to clean the floors in my home.
customer_reviews.author: Essa Kidwell

customer_reviews.title: GoCleanCo recommendation doesn’t disappoint!
customer_reviews.text: Okay yes I saw GoCleanCo on instagram and based on her recommendation for this vacuums.. ITS AWESOME!! The suction is crazy good. Light. Easy to maneuver. I noticed some of the reviews said the hoses come out easily and yes I did notice that occasionally they pop out... I just put a piece of double stick tape around the smaller side of the hose and it’s all it needed to stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Keltner

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hate this vacuum so much so that I gave it away to my parents after the first use. I would’ve sent it back but didn’t feeling making it fit back in the box it came in. First off this thing kills your back trying to clean because of the short hose. Secondly, it’s hard to move back and forth. This thing causes me more frustration than anything. For my dad, he likes to use this on hard surfaces and small area rugs.
customer_reviews.author: Zavi's Mami

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the cost
customer_reviews.text: We just got a house that is completely hardwood, so I was looking for vacuum that could keep up with a dog and teenagers. I have had this vacuum for 1 month and I'm very pleased. Im petite so the light weight is a huge plus. I do have some troubles with keeping the floor piece flat on the floor it feels too light to stay firm on the floor. But this is a small inconvenience. The plug in cord is very short, so I have to use an extension cord. If there was one thing I would change it definitely would be cord length. But still a great buy for the price
customer_reviews.author: RL*pedsRN

customer_reviews.title: Another great Bissell product that was exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I hoped for sucks great for removal of cat fur off velvet furniture and is great to get the fur and dust off floor. No it is not a $700 Dyson but works great on tile, furniture etc . The maneuvering would be quite awkward if I tried to do full house carpeting but really for approx $40 this is really great and I am happy to continue to purchase Bissell products as they do seem to know what works for us pet lovers and I am sure the more expensive bissell products just get better and better..# 1 Bissell fan with 7 rescue cats
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. I have one for downstairs and decided to get one for upstairs as well. It's small and light, so I could have just stayed with the one, but having a second is really convenient. These work great on bare floors, but also clean carpets better than uprights. For carpets, you have to pull it towards you because it's really hard to push against the carpet. The wand pieces don't interlock, so they can slip apart. You have to really push them together to get them to stay connected. Very easy to empty the canister. The canister also comes apart so it can be easily washed when needed.
customer_reviews.author: T. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: I like this so far. I have been using it for about 3 weeks and works good enough. Suction could be better. Filter clogs up quickly and has to be cleaned. It's messy taking the filter out and a job to clean it. It's very handy and light weight. I don't have hardwood floors or carpet so, I don't know how it works on them. The two attachments are very small. Probably made for a Hobbit's house.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: I’m not one to write bad reviews. I always try and find a positive in everything. Cons- This vacuum is such a pain to use! The canister gets stuck on every corner and piece of furniture. It’s almost impossible to vacuum carpets, unless they are super low pile. Forget about area rugs! I have a lot of runners in my house because I have dogs. They totally get sucked up into the vacuum. Very maddening and frustrating. Pros- easy to clean out the canister and the retractable cord is wonderful. Also, works amazingly on wood floors. Doesn’t spit everything back at you. That’s the only reason I’m keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Shepard

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS LITTLE POWERHOUSE
customer_reviews.text: What it does it does VERY well. I do not believe this will replace an upright / carpet vacuum. It does an amazing job baseboards, dusting, drawers, fans, etc. Great for hard floors. Add a horsehair brush (sold separately) for best impact. GoCleanCo (Instagram) recommends this and I can see why. It's a game changer even for a neat freak who thought I already knew how to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Life Out Loud

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: As I get older vacuuming is more difficult. I'd been looking for a new canister and actually purchased five others before this Bissell Zing. They were all too heavy for me to drag around. I decided to give this one a try and I'm glad I finally did. The suction power is very strong but it is adjustable. It's so easy to pull around. The first day I got it I did 6 rooms of floorboards. I wouldn't have been able to do that with the heavier machines, especially the ones with metal attachments. It's easy to hold with arthritic hands because it's so light. If something happens to this one I'd buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Good, but room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Could use more suction power. Lightweight and makes the stairs easier. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: SereneAmber

customer_reviews.title: Finally a vacuum for hardwood floors and walls
customer_reviews.text: This is not a vacuum for carpet. However, this is perfect for hardwood floors and light enough to pick up and vacuum your stairs or walls. I use this vacuum much more than any other vacuum I have ever had. It is perfect for getting the small nooks and crannies that a larger vacuum would ignore. I even vacuum my entire bathroom and remove the dust before cleaning it.
customer_reviews.author: Reads Too Much

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before I bought this, including a lot of the reviews posted for this particular vacuum. First, I agree that Bissell should have made the pipes and attachments snap together, rather than rely on friction. It’s irritating when you have your wand or something fall apart at a critical moment. I’m thinking of using hose clamps to correct for it. The other thing I noted was a few people complaining that it tended to lose suction. Might help if you actually clean the filters out, and I mean removing them and washing them out. That’s what the manufacturer recommends. Doing that, I’ve seen no loss of suction.
customer_reviews.author: Martin W. Novak

customer_reviews.title: SPEND MORE MONEY, BECAUSE YOU'RE GOING TO WASTE MORE LATER ANYWAYS
customer_reviews.text: DEAR GOD who invented this, please please go back to school. The mechanism behind using this is ridiculous. I have to put pressure and move the vacuum around. I do more work than the vacuum. It was difficult to maneuver and take apart. It does not vacuum or suction hair. I have LABELS left over from CHEAP ABERCOMBIE AND FITCH receipt that picks up more hair and dust than this vacuum. So tell me, does this vacuum work? Common sense. Spend more money for a decent investment. IF you spend on a cheap vacuum, you gonna replace with another cheap one.... that's likely more money than a brand new WORKING vacuum folks.
customer_reviews.author: AnhAnh

customer_reviews.title: Love this little guy!
customer_reviews.text: I have hardwood floors and a cat who I swear sheds his body weight in fur every day. I have to vacuum the floors and furniture several times a week. This vacuum does both excellently. The suction is amazing. I use the floor brush on the ottoman and the fuzz disappears. It’s easy to empty unlike my old bagless that got dirt all over the floor every time I emptied it. The filter is super simple to clean. I prefer to spray it out with the yard hose but the kitchen sink works just as well in the winter. It’s lightweight and portable. I’d buy it again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Townsend

customer_reviews.title: High-Powered Handheld Vacuum w/Cord for Hard Floors, Furniture, Corners/Molding — Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: This vacuum has awesome suction. The cord retracts which I like. Super easy to empty out and clean the canister. Canister has big capacity. CONS: There isn't convenient built-in storage for the long hose or most of the attachments, which is my only real complaint. It's a little unwieldy to store. It's handheld, but not especially small. OVERALL JUDGEMENT: RECOMMEND! It's great for using in corners, under behind appliances, or along molding (especially with a horsehair brush attachment, which I bought separately); also great for use on hardwood floors (with the floor attachment that's included) and on upholstery. Note that the floor attachment does not have a beater meaning it's not really meant for carpet.
customer_reviews.author: MSG2018

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cleaning car interior
customer_reviews.text: For the house we have a stick vacuum with no attachments so I needed something to clean our cars with. One of them is a Jeep that frequently gets used on the beach so it accumulates a lot of sand. A handheld vacuum like a Dustbuster isn’t adequate. I keep the Zing in the garage. It is so perfect for cleaning car interiors that I wonder if Bissell should market this not as a low-end household vac, but as a high-end automotive vac. The Zing isn’t that much more costly than a Dustbuster but it’s effectiveness is much better.
customer_reviews.author: F W Hough

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this vacuum, but it was not what we expected. It blows a lot of hot air down onto the hardwood floors blowing everything into the air. Terrible for allergies. Emptying the canister will make you want to die. You have to get your hand up in the filter and get hair and nasty stuff out. Not worth the cheap price for us. It does have a decent amount of suction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Vacuum For Its Size
customer_reviews.text: This product has powerful suction. I originally wanted a small shop vac, but I found this and I am very satisfied with its performance. My only complaint is that the attachments sometimes come undone from the hose while I am using it. I've used it to clean my car, clean ceilings, clean up a powder mess. I've had no issues so far with performance.
customer_reviews.author: srj33

customer_reviews.title: It really sucks!! If it doesn't fall apart first....
customer_reviews.text: All in all this is a great little vacuum. Great suction power and easy to clean the filters. Theres a few things that are disappointing about it though. The power cord is not long enough. I'm constantly having to move the plug to closer outlets as I vacuum. Another thing, as you can see in the photos I posted, the plastic parts in the filter come off right away. They are not supposed to. I've tried to hot glue them back together, but it only lasted about 2 weeks. I'm really sad about because the suction power is really really good on this little machine. Also, the plastic tubing comes apart easily. Bissell, please send me a replacement filter!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I LOVE IT!!! The suction power is great! I LOVE that the cord has the button to real back in, no cord hassle. I ordered a horse hair attachment to go with it; cleaning baseboards and couches are so much less hassle. Very pleased!! Recommended by gocleanco. Thank you! I also love that I didn’t have to spend hundreds of dollars! Great find!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use great price. Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great. Perfect for my apartment. Works easy on rugs and floors. The only problem I've had is the two little wheels on the end of the vacuum get caught with a lot of hair it's hard to cut out. Other than that love it for the price. It's pretty light too. It also has a nice vacuum head holder so you don't have to just lay the hose down, ilike that. I usually run the filter inside under water every 5 times I use it, let it dry 24 hours before putting it back in to use it
customer_reviews.author: callie

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Fenomenal!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, best spent money in a long time! It does feel a little plasticy, but the suction and how easy it is to maneuver and clean easily overcompensates the plasticy feel of it. Absolutely fenomenal om hardwood floor. I was loosing my mind with those stupid vacuums that has the brushes in the nossle, big and klunky and so inconvenient.. This one is light and easy even when doing stairs with carpet. The only negative I can say is that the cable is quite short and if you dont have many outlets you may need an extension cord but that's the only negative thing I will say about the little beast!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: This little vacuum works!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this vacuum because it seemed to fit my needs. I have a home with high ceilings and hardwood floors which are both difficult to manage. This vacuum allows me to reach the high ceiling corners, curtain rods all while carrying the compact canister around with me and is much more powerful than I expected.. The container is easy to empty. It helps me manage the hardwood floors and I can simply suck everything up instead of sweeping corners and under furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Kecia Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Great suction, light weight
customer_reviews.text: It’s kind of like a shop vac. Great suction. Easy to get around. Light weight. Works great on cement floors, Hardwood floors, furniture and carpet. I’d buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super little vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the amount of suction power this little vacuum has. It is so light weight that I can actually vacuum the stairs without straining my back. It has a hard floor setting and a carpet setting. I use the carpet setting on the stairs. It does the carpet better than I thought but of course it doesn't pull as deep into the carpet as a full size vacuum. I have a Dyson stick vac and the Zing gets the hard floors just as well and I don't run out of battery before I'm done!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie B.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the floor attachment on hardwood!
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this item because it scratched my floors the very first time I used it! We have antique reclaimed heart pine floors with high gloss finish and this would have destroyed it if I hadn’t been watching! There are Plastic wheels On the floor attachment ... I don’t even know why there are wheels since you use your arm to push the vacuum back and forth; any other floor attachment for hardwood just has the brush all around the edge. Those wheels were so loud and hard I immediately looked down and could see the grooves. Back it went!!! It stinks because it had great suction for a small machine.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little vacuum! I felt like my current vacuum wasn't picking up enough from the stairs and the area where baseboards meet the carpet. This vacuum has so much suction and I'm amazed and slightly stunned by the amount it picked up just from going along the edge of the carpet. I've done my whole house and I feel like my carpets are actually clean.
customer_reviews.author: Samurai Dog

customer_reviews.title: Electric issues possibly shorting out.
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved this and used it less than 20 minutes. 2 things got my attention. 1st when trying to extend the cord while in use power went off then on. Then 2nd was the smell of burning. Not taking chances returning it. As for the suction its great for the small amount of use it was great in cleaning. Too bad , when it comes to fire don't play.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Mex

customer_reviews.title: Good product but dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum is great and holds sucking but the electric plug metal prones are sharp for some reason and got a deep cut to the thumb when trying to pull the cable out. Sharp as a surgical knife...will have to file it down with something...dont trust the cable retraction with the prones being the way they are.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I now have 3 of these: one in the city apartment, and two at my two-story house in the country. They're light to carry around, very convenient with wire storage and support for the wand in the base. But most of all they suck! Their suction is strong (as long as you keep the filter clean), and they work as well as any vacuum I've ever had. I said if it breaks, so thats $50. No big deal. But they keep working, and working well. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: wiseGuy

customer_reviews.title: Issues with suction
customer_reviews.text: I don't have carpet, just some area rugs. I thought this would be the perfect vacuum cleaner. It's lightweight, has a retractable cord and is easy to handle. I made a point of emptying the canister every time I used it. Unfortunately, it started to lose suction after about the eighth time I used it. It gets worse each time I vacuum. It's very disappointing. I have tried everything I could think of to make it work, without any luck.
customer_reviews.author: mamalonghorn45

customer_reviews.title: Definitely needs longer or more extensitions
customer_reviews.text: With the way the large vacuum head sits, you can not get a good angle for vacuuming, it requires that you stand at a shallow angle behind the vacuum head. It would be very nice to see a revised vacuum head that would allow the user to stand more upright and natural, rather than bending over to use it. Other than that alone, I like this vacuum for the price. It is a little better than I had initially anticipated, aside from not being able to stand fully upright.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlet

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money as it burned up after less than 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: Originally super happy with this product. For the money I paid, the functionality was great(obviously doesn’t compare to my dyson, but great for what I paid) . I use this for a spare room in the basement and have probably used this Vacuum less than 10 times (for about 5min). I went to use it yesterday and the motor blew and was burning. Was not used for anything crazy, just your typical dirt, debris and possibly a few spiders, here and there. So now, it’s just annoying, bc it’s shot and done for. So my opinion has definitely changed for this vacuum and is not worth the couple of dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Rivals a Dyson
customer_reviews.text: Bought this vacuum based on the reviews but was skeptical because of the price. I had an unfortunate tapeworm nightmare with my kitten and was using a friend's handheld Dyson to deep clean my house since my old vacuum didn't have enough suction to clean like I needed. I bought this that same night and it arrived 2 days later. Incredibly lightweight, easy to use, easy to empty, and the suction is insane! I thought I was going to have to get rid of my flokati rug, but this little vacuum saved the day. Great for rugs, floors, hard to reach corners, ceiling fans, and the ceiling. Buy this vacuum!!!
customer_reviews.author: MaidenHeaven

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, not as good as the original
customer_reviews.text: The original bagged version of this vacuum was WAY better. When I went to repurchase the same model it was no longer available so I bought this, thinking bag less would be nice. Nope, this thing needs to be emptied constantly, and not because it is full, as soon as it gets any hair or dust, it sticks to the filter cover and loses suction. I just want the old Zing 😞 the hose on the prior model was metal, this is very thin plastic, same with the attachments, all very cheap compared to the original.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is great for hardwood floors. I use it on my sofas as well. For thick carpet, it does okay. The hose attachment will sometimes disassemble from itself. Having so many cats, we have fur all about. It's great for picking up fuzz and debris from hardwood floors. Our stairs, which are carpeted, need something a bit more heavy duty. As far suction, it's got a good bit of power for something very small. It picks up cat litter no problem. 6 months later and the product still functions as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney and Devin Lattin

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: It is tiny - but it sure has suction! Since my wife's dog is constantly shedding, I use this daily to suck up hair. We have a Kirby - which is great for carpets - but this is small and quick and handy for along the edges and into the corners. I just used it to clean all the hair off two couches because friends were coming over. It comes with a nice little stiff brush attachment that worked great. I got off a gallon of hair! The canister is quick and easy to empty - although you do have to reach up inside to pull out the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: lightweight canister vac
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have a functional one, this little canister vac is a surprising performer. Used on carpet, it actually picks up about as much dirt as a 4 hp shop vacuum I was using. It's very light, which makes it much easier to use. The self retracting power cord is great. The only reason I deducted a star was that once one has the dirt chamber apart to clean off the filter, it's a bit of a problem to get it together right again. Other than that, it's definitely big bang for small bucks! I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Three stars just because the suction power is good!
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Compact, light weight, easy to maneuver, good suction power, nice bright color if that matters and good for the price. Easy to clean. Dislikes: Dust reflects from the broom end of the unit (see the pictures attached), the dust quickly build up on the filter inside ad doesn’t accumulate properly in the bag (see picture), the collecting bag get filled quickly due to small unit size, the broom has a gray button that will stuck underneath your furniture and you have to lower the button by hand to release the broom from underneath the furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if I'd like but so far I do. I needed one that pulled easily ( I have a bad back) and one that had pretty good suction and was easy to switch from floors to rugs. This little vacuum does the trick. One other reviewer wrote that it has enough suction to cause some issues on the rugs because it's powerful enough to pick them up so that's why I rated less than a 5. It does make more work for me to step on the rug and hold it down while I vacuum it. But I also have a little stick vacuum that works for that, so I'm good.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not a carpet vacuum... better suited for hardwood/tile floors
customer_reviews.text: This is more like a Shop Vac than a vacuum. It has decent suction but if you’ve ever used a Shop Vac you’ll understand what I mean by it not being a vacuum. It unfortunately isn’t really built for home use. Particles were coming out of the hose a bit and while it did pick up hair etc from the carpet it took forever to vacuum one room and stairs because it doesn’t have the power of a vacuum. It worked well on my hardwood floors so I think it’s better suited for that. I will unfortunately be returning it as I need a better vacuum for carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Mimica Blasco

customer_reviews.title: Filters don’t last
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little green zing vacuum until i could not find filters for it. The filters are washable but the way they hook in wears out. We had 2 vacuums and wanted a couple extra filters. The ones we found on Amazon are not the right ones- check the model numbers. I contact Bissell when I didn’t find them on their website but never heard back. Both vacuums are only about a year and a half old but aren’t holding the filters properly anymore so I’m shopping for a new vacuum again. Most likely won’t be a zing
customer_reviews.author: pmal

customer_reviews.title: Nice little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because ours shop vac is just a little loud for regular use in our small house. Works like a charm. We have two rooms with carpet and the rest is hard floors. It does a far better job getting the carpets feeling nice than the reviews led me to believe. The only downside is we have two cats and the canister has to be emptied about eighty percent of the way through (we have about 714 square feet) because the cat hair is stuck all around the filter and we lose suction. Good thing it's really easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jalenie Ellis

customer_reviews.title: It broke in less then a month
customer_reviews.text: At first, I thought it was fantastic and then it started to not work as well. The filter broke so I hot glued that thinking that I might be able to fix it. The suction is just slight, now. I cant get my work done until I order anoer kInd. Everything collects in the machine where the hose connects. It is a nice compact machine but I pick up a lot of dog food and evidently it's just not made for that
customer_reviews.author: Katie5496

customer_reviews.title: Great power/suction
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time purchasing this vacuum. The first time was a few yrs ago. I've really used it alot. Decided to buy another and it's an upgraded unit and I love it. Canister is easy to dump and clean. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: GAIL SUTHERLAND

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum power great, Very light weight, the hose/tube assembly is worthless.
customer_reviews.text: It is a fine vacuum, but the tubing is so flimsy and thin that any effort pulling on it separates the parts. The plastic is just not strong enough for an effective friction fit. The suction works so well that on shag type carpet it is almost impossible to use one handed as you need your other hand to hold the pieces together. On hardwood and linoleum the problem is not as evident. I might cannibalize my old vacuum to see if I can make the hose and tube work better with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Tannardog

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this. It reminds me of the vacuums we have in europe. I hate those heavy ugly American vacuums that make a whole alot noise, yet zero results. You also need to be really careful with those clumsy heavy things since if you vacuum anything more than cat hair the belt brokes and whole thing breaks down. This vacuum doesn't have those problems, its literally light as a feather, easy to drag after you, it doesn't have belts, its easy to clean and most importantly IT IS REALLY POWERFUL. 10points.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Since my husband broke my old vacuum cleaner he had to get a new one which means I have to start cleaning again. It’s so small I was able to get under some of the furniture and narrow spots much better. Which means Im now going to have to a better job of cleaning 🙄. And the dog who may or not have involved with the distraction of old one, does not seem to annoy her as much... HOWEVER it’s not shedding season so that may change (I will let you know how that issue goes at a later time. It also did well on the low shag area rug when vacuumed with the brush out and going one way.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Corke

customer_reviews.title: Hard Working Little Helper
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like it. A longer crevice tool would be better. The hose is like most vac hoses and tangles at times. Lightweight and easy to carry or set up on something for high ceilings when needed. Exc. adjustable suction. Cleaning out the canister is best with a utility brush for the cylinder. No one loves this part but it’s necessary. Works well even with fine silty dust. I’ve been using it during construction and have been happy with its ability to clean the super fine dust from sHeetrock to tile work in the house. Hardworking little vacuum! Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: jackie's

customer_reviews.title: Bissell never let's me down!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small light weight canister vacuum with attachments to do lampshades and furniture. I didn't want a rechargeable hand held one because they are too heavy. This Bissell is perfect for my needs. It has a retractable cord and is nice and light weight. I don't know how it works on stairs because I live in a ranch condo. The cord might be a little short for doing stairs. I love that it has no bag and is so easy to use. I've always had great luck with Bissell products.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L.

customer_reviews.title: amazing suction power for our addition to collect dust and dog hair
customer_reviews.text: Do not apply alot of pressure to hose hard plastic part a bit week but the suction power is amazing ..... our pups shed alot and this little gem totes works to get all that hair I had to pull out a throw rug from the nozzle oh my ! love it great price and great item to get the job done for sure works like a charm on stairs , hardwood floors and even concrete and carpets !
customer_reviews.author: kadu4u

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: Love this little machine. Most of my home is hardwood and tile. My bedrooms are carpet and I use a shark vacuum for those. This works great everywhere else! Sucks up stray kitty litter and crumbs that my vacuum threw out the back
customer_reviews.author: Bee Jay

customer_reviews.title: NIFTY CHEAP, LIGHTWEIGHT VAC
customer_reviews.text: Grabbed this as the older vac died. We have 90% hardwood floors and I learned a long time ago that the weight of a vac isn't related to its "suck" power. This is lightweight with good suck. Kind of like the Bic lighter of vacs. No need for more. Memo to vac makers: post the NIF (Negative Iinspiratory Force) of your machines. That is the key metric.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Reader

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly-great suction for such a little machine!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this just to clean up crumbs, dust bunnies, kitty litter and hair off the hardwood floor. It has great suction and is so much more maneuverable than a large vacuum cleaner and so much faster than using a broom and dustpan. We have started using it on carpet in the room where the kitty litter is and it works surprisingly well there also. Our only complaint is that the long tube that connects to the rounded tube near the handle is always disconnecting and falling out, regardless of how tightly we try to insert it.
customer_reviews.author: Andi S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use. Great Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum, light weight and easy to move around, used for my hard wood floors, rugs and tiles. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: LYRA GRANDS

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is like a child's toy. It literally probably only weighs 2 - 3 pounds total, so it feels so super cheap as a result. Every piece on this thing is plastic junk. I could live with the canister being so tiny and light, but the wand and head are horrible; no turning brush, hard to turn so that it actually stays flat to the ground, and pretty useless on carpet. I will never buy a larger buy like this online again where I don't have the luxury of walking it back to the store to return.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa DJ

customer_reviews.title: You don’t need the extras if it just flat out works!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST vacuum cleaner I’ve ever had! I think it is a cross between a shop vac and a regular vacuum. It doesn’t clog-unless you suck up something obvious-like a sock. It is super light weight and easy to maneuver. The wand gets flat-like a person doing the limbo-and still vacuums under things, like couches and chairs. AND THE CORD IS RETRACTABLE!!! Highly recommend! Good bye bulky overly customized, “luxury” vacuum cleaners! This one just works effortlessly!
customer_reviews.author: smartconsumer

customer_reviews.title: I’d sell these.
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying this vacuum. This is excellent for someone with back troubles, as most of the weight is on the ground on wheels. My old vacuum left me in pain and “done” for the day. Only complaint is that the part you push on the ground does not have wheels, it just slides...which works wonders on my wood floors and base boards but doesn’t move to easily over my rugs. That being said, it does work well on rugs, just a little hard to maneuver on carpeted areas.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I've read other reviews that say they love this as a supplemental vacuum when they don't want to get their main vacuum out, but I don't need anything else. I don't have thick carpet and this vac works great on hardwood floors and rugs. In spite of being a lightweight bagless, the suction is outstanding. Also the design is intuitive. Using, emptying, and cleaning this unit is a snap. Glowing review all around.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Good little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Works on hardwood floors. I do not have carpeting but based on the string suction I'm sure it would work well. I needed it to also vacuum my car and it works well for that. The only gripe (or it would be a 5 star) is the long hose and how it attaches, clumsy and the clip looks fragile, but I will find a work-around. For the money, you get a good name brand and it does the job well
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Been using weekly for a month and a half; no issues.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after deciding to replace my ancient, and barebones Dirt Devil. Did a lot of exhaustive research online to find a functional, quality vacuum at this price point, and the Bissell Zing emerged as the top contender. It's easy to assemble, has amazing suction capabilities, and works handily on both my carpets and wood-style laminate floors. If properly maintained, I expect this vacuum to last a while. Not crazy about the color, but what can you do?
customer_reviews.author: HF

customer_reviews.title: Need new seal!
customer_reviews.text: I struggled removing the canister and the photo shows why. The sticky seal was placed incorrectly and was stuck to the canister. I’d appreciate a new seal as this one ripped once I removed the canister. As for working, I wanted a vacuum I could go from floor to base boards and this does the job. I took the brush attachment from another vacuum as the brush included was not cutting it, the bristles are short so unless you angle it just right the baseboards are hardly touched. I also wish the attachments could be stored on the machine, I’m carrying them around in my pocket to be readily available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap vacuum - get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum works fine for hardwood floors. It is cumbersome on stairs. Just a little too heavy to be a portable and carry behind you, and doesn't have a long enough reach to do a stair case from the top or bottom (meeting in the middle). Although it claims it works on carpeting, I found it fair at best on flat area rugs, I can't imagine it picking up anything on pile. Since most of my house is wood, it's useful, but I wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Mendelson Klauss

customer_reviews.title: Solid upgrade from old Zing
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum clearer. What's not to like for the money? Very small and powerful. Nice redesign from the original model (of which I've owned 3). Still easy to clean. One big improvement was the location of the button to release the dirt unit from the body. Old button was large and easy to push while you were carrying the vacuum and motor would go crashing to the floor - not good. New button is placed so this is much harder to accidentally do this. Buy this vacuum - you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Ross J. Mehan

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our apartment, we have hardwood floors and I wanted a lightweight vacuum for grabbing dust especially in corners and hard to reach places. It has 2 lightweight extension arms (not flimsy) that have a nice reach. It also has a long retractable power cord so you don’t need to switch outlets. Very compact design, good power, comes with three heads. I’m still going to use an upright for carpets, but this is better for general cleaning. Getting a second one for our vacation home.
customer_reviews.author: Khalid O.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: This works well for what I need. It has great suction, light weight. Short cord though and the the pieces of the wand kept detaching while I used it. I added sticky Velcro pieces to hold them. I have a shag area rug, so I got it for that and it’s good suction is perfect.. Works well on my wood floors too. Dirt container is easy to empty. All-in-all, you get what you pay for, so it’s great for the cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Bbj

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: This is the most flimsiest vacuum I’ve put together. I was terrified to have the hoses break if I pushed them further to stay. The length wasn’t good and it’s not very ergonomical. I didn’t bother turning it on. On the bright side it’s very light. I’ve used Bissell products in the past and surprised to see this garbage come from them.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Clumpsy & Falls Apart
customer_reviews.text: Good vision but not in real life. The tubes continuously come undone (vacuum tubes) I have to keep pushing them back together. The vacuum head is weird. It's so low to the ground that you have to continuously pick up to vacuum larger objects (blueberries) so not smooth at all. Hard surface, rug, carpet - you will always have to pick the head up and place It directly on the object you want to vacuum. Also the cord should be much longer. Quite stiff as well.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great for fur
customer_reviews.text: Love this! We have a Dyson upright and it doesn’t fit under the beds, which is where my dog likes to hang out. He sheds. A lot. His fur is the same color as my rugs, so you can’t tell how sorry they are until a fresh load of laundry is sitting in the hamper of the floor and then is covered in fur. I got this because I’m too lazy to haul the Dyson upstairs. So for $50 this is my upstairs vacuum, and I love it! I was very impressed with the power and the fur and dirt it pulled up.
customer_reviews.author: SL22

customer_reviews.title: Great and impressive for cleaning up cat hair and such
customer_reviews.text: Actually just got finished using it. No problems ever. Have cats so faithful on hairballs and stray litter around the house. Has always done wonders. Great product. The best I have used in awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Prickett

customer_reviews.title: ***BEWARE! SCRATCHES FLOORS***
customer_reviews.text: I vacuumed my whole house before I realized there were MICRO SCRATCHES all over my vinyl floors. I realized it's because the the wheels don't raise the attachment at all so the plastic on the bottom is scraping across your floor as you vacuum. I'm not sure why you would design a vacuum head that is meant for hard floors like this. I've tried rubbing them to see if they would come up but alas, my floors are now ruined.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin B

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum is awesome. The extensions are long and help reach cobwebs on the ceilings. It's suction is very strong and on wood floors this thing is exactly what I was looking for. It gets my dog hair up easily and when my dogs are blowing their coats I'm usually vacuuming 4 to 5 times a day, with this vacuum you get the length reach, suction on hard surfaces and the light weight advantages. I highly recommend this vacuum if you have wood floors, children and shedding dogs! I have 6 kids, 4 dogs and 5 cats.... It works.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisT

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months ago. I wanted something lightweight to carry around the house. I have not had the problems that some other customers had. I love this little vaccume. It was just what i needed. Especially Great for stairs or quick messes. Can be used anywhere in the house. Carpet and hardwood. The suction power is great. The price is just right for the product. No problems here.
customer_reviews.author: CarolinaLady81

customer_reviews.title: This little vacuum works for me
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous model vac and thought it was the best designed little vacuum ever. I don't know how many years I had it but finally decided to get a newer vac instead of buying a new filter part. This vac is better designed than the old one with a bigger and easier to remove and clean cannister, Otherwise just as handy and with great suction power as the older model.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Gainer

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 recommend for hard floors
customer_reviews.text: I am a housekeeper and recommend this product if you have hard floors. Doesn’t work great on carpets due to not having a rotating brush but if you have hardwoods, tile, etc this is a game changer. Small, convenient, easy to use. I love that with a tap of your foot you can wind the chord all the way up hands free.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for hardwood and laminate
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little lightweight vaccum for our loft style house. Very easy to use on the spiral staircase, and suction is fantastic. I love the baseboard attachment to get the seemingly endless footage of baseboard properly cleaned. Beats the stick vaccum we had prior, and is able to tackle an insane amount of border collie tumbleweed fur and my waist length hair strands.
customer_reviews.author: VeganVixen

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not good for people with allergies
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum does have good suction and worked well on both hardwood and carpet. The suction is very good. However, it exhausted or blows out so hard through the back of it that the air becomes more dusty while using it. Not a good vacuum for a person with allergies as it claims. This occurred even while it was brand new. I understand the need to vent out the system, but this one is bad. I am not happy with this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: M&M'S

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum for hardwoods/tile
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I have all hardwood/tile floor and a few low pile rugs. The suction on this vacuum is amazing. Sucked up a hidden sock (on accident) like it was nothing. I have a dyson handheld and it does not where near as good of a job. Great at getting dust up in hard to reach places. Have to get used to the cord but really like how I can move the hose easily without the huge vacuum. Smaller than expected so easier to store. May not do great on high pile carpet. There is no moving brush but the bristles do grab the pet hair.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Not for carpeting
customer_reviews.text: This does not work well on carpeting that has any pile at all so the description “multi-surface “ is misleading. It is great for bare floors, is lightweight and has good suction but almost impossible to use in anything but indoor/outdoor carpeting. Notice the pictures they provide are only on bare floors.
customer_reviews.author: Skydog

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum for a low price!
customer_reviews.text: We just sold our house and moved to a small rental temporarily and it has wood floors. This works great for wood or tile floors and area rugs. It has sort of a funky floor tool as it has a short brush and seems almost like it is scraping the floor but the suction is amazing and it works well enough for our needs. The hose is pretty stiff but hey, it is what it is. Very lightweight, great suction, added tools are nice to have and moves easily behind you. The retractable cord is a very nice feature! Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Cherylbz

customer_reviews.title: Cord Rewind Does Not work
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this product. It is the first vacuum I've ever owned so I really dont have anything to compare it to. The suction works great, but again it's only day 1. The reason why I am giving it 3stars is because the power cord rewind button does not work. The cord is really long to just keep it wrapped around- I think 60 dollars is not worth that look. I would like to give it a second chance and replace it, but I am in desperate need of a vaccum and can't afford to have the same issue happen again. I will be returning the item
customer_reviews.author: Dahiana

customer_reviews.title: Happy housework
customer_reviews.text: Love this little vacuum. Like the design like the way it works. Did notice one thing in reading other reviews. It was about the extensions coming apart while vacuuming. Happened to me also until I figured out that was what the foot switch on the head was that raised it up to allow air flow. Too much suction otherwise. It is great for my studio as it is compact and powerful and looks a whole lot better than the shop vac I was using.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Brill

customer_reviews.title: This item became defective in less than 60 days!
customer_reviews.text: This product started out working great! However, the cheap plastic pieces were no longer working after 3 uses. When I attempt to use the vacuum now the hole that is supposed to "drop" the dirt or debris gets clogged (constantly) and I have to remove the canister to clear it. Amazon refused to help or offer any assistance and stated that Bissel would help me with a warranty. I do not have time for all of that. I am disappointed in the product and in Amazons support regarding this item. Do not Buy, it will not last!
customer_reviews.author: A. Johns

customer_reviews.title: No Need For A Broom
customer_reviews.text: I love this lightweight vacuum. I bought this a month ago and use it daily! I don't even use the broom anymore. It's super light weigh and very easy to clean. Literally, you can detach just about everything to disinfect and clean all the parts to keep it in tip top shape. The suction is great and so convenient for big messy or small every day crumbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks can be deceiving...
customer_reviews.text: I just unboxed this and used it for the first time... what an incredible little machine... the suction power is amazing!!! Takes a minute to get used to the floor tool as it doesn't glide like my previous vacuum... but once I figured out how to move it across my carpet, I was impressed... and disgusted at how much dirt was in the carpet... If you want a compact, powerful, and inexpensive machine... this is for you...
customer_reviews.author: Shelle Ann

customer_reviews.title: Versatile vacuum that performs way better than expected for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is just what I was looking for! It's lightweight and the large wheels enable me to move about easily. The 16 ft. cord limits having to unplug it often. I have used the brush attachment on blinds and furniture and the angled attachment us great for corners and baseboards. The wand attaches to standard shop vac extensions so I was able to reach my 12 foot ceilings. If you don't have extra extensions laying around, the vacuum is lightweight enough you could easily hold it and stand on a step ladder to reach average height ceilings and ceiling fans. The price was very affordable, suction is stellar and the retractable cord is a nice bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Emily C.

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised at how much I like this little vacuum. It is light, easy to maneuver, and the suction is quite powerful. Its small size is perfect for the limited amount of space in my small, mostly uncarpeted apartment. It works well enough on carpet, but if you want every last particle removed from the depths of the carpeting, then I might find a different vacuum. I am a little concerned about its durability because it feels a little cheap, but for all I know it will last for years. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: the suction power is great
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews that said the hose extensions keep coming apart but bought it anyway. The reviews were true. It does keep coming apart and will need duct tape to keep them together. It's not good on rugs as the suction is too great but it is good on vinyl and hardwood floors. I will keep it cause it does the job on uncarpeted floors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong for Small Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed - something smaller with attachments. The suction is real strong - sucks better than I expected. It is very hard to push back and forth on rug. I have the low, outdoors type and there’s resistance. Will probably use my old attachment for the rug. Speaking of attachments, they could have done better than two tiny-looking dust brush and wand. It still did what I wanted the attachments to Di however. Overall, a good buy and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Djuli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Replaced old Dyson animal vacuum with this. Suction power is just as good (we have hardwood floors, which may help, but also have dogs). Non-fixed hose parts makes switching head attachments while cleaning very easy. Flexible head is great to get under sofas etc. Small size helpful for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

product_meta.title: Bissell Zing Canister, 2156A Vacuum, Green Bagless
product_meta.description: Color:Green Bagless| Style:Zing CanisterThe Bissell zing Bagless canister vacuum makes it easy to take powerful mess removal from one room in your home to another. It features cyclonic technology that provides powerful, continuous suction across both carpets and hard floors. The compact and lightweight design along with swivel steering make maneuvering around furniture and between rooms a snap. The easy empty dirt cup provides mess-free, bottom-tank emptying to keep dirt off of your hands. The included tools let you clean those hard-to-reach areas of your home with ease. Buying this product saves pets. Bissell proudly supports Bissell pet foundation and its mission to help save homeless pets. When you buy a Bissell product, you help save pets, too. We’re proud to design products that help make pet messes, odors and pet homelessness disappear.
feature_bullets: Dirt cup capacity 2 liters; Cyclonic action and powerful suction provide thorough cleaning; Plus, no more bags to buy or change ever
Easily go from cleaning carpets to hard floors with the flip of a switch. Power rating : 9 ampere
Dirt cup filters and post motor filter help capture more fine dust and particles. Filters are washable and reusable
15 feet of cord for great cleaning reach and retracts with the touch of a button for easy storage
Weighs less than eight pounds. Easy to maneuver with the integrated carrying handle

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars6,076 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
